pr_title: feat: add regional and edge support

timeline.message: feat: add regional and edge support

timeline.bodyText: Why are we removing the try/catch? Concerned we are breaking someone's implementation expecting this exception, though that seems unlikely and/or rare.
timeline.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: It's no longer possible the throw UnsupportedEncodingException here because we're using StandardCharsets.US_ASCII instead of "ascii".
replies.author: childish-sambino

replies.bodyText: Should we mark this as a breaking change?
replies.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: It's not breaking. The exception should never have been thrown to begin with. It's meant to catch cases where the charset was not know until runtime.
replies.author: childish-sambino

timeline.bodyText: nit - might be good to hold the other pieces in nicely named variables.
timeline.author: thinkingserious

replies.bodyText: Meh, we haven't done that elsewhere.
replies.author: childish-sambino
